channel.title: DreamShield install creator
channel.description:
[quote="DreamShield"] A free deployment tool to create installer program for any .NET based applications but also dynamic updates from a web server. You can also publish directly your software to a web server with only a few clicks. It's mainly developed in C# but contains portions in C++.
DreamShield is a publishing tool through which it is possible to create installers to publish Microsoft .NET based applications. You can also choose whether to include the setup of the .NET Framework itself with your package for an easy distribution. It is possible to create setup then put them on a CD or to create a self-extracting archive with only one application in order to allow an easy downloading from a website.
With DreamShield you can install files, modify the registry, create shorcuts, register your files with gacutil, installutil, regsvr, and even run a Windows Installer based setup during the installation. There is also many possibilities to customize your setup through writing plugins or chose a skin to introduce your software with a good customer experience.
The installer has a full rollback possibilities in case of something going wrong and as a big improvement over many other freeware installers, DreamShield can create update for your product to modify a component, or automatically upgrade a product from one version to another. [/quote] This description says everything you should know about DreamShield. This install creator has a beautiful installer interface and some cool things as described above. Personally I have installed DreamShield right now but I haven't tested it yet so I don't know its disavantages. As far as I know, DreamShield is created by smyley that is from France so the documentation is in french but it can be translated with Google Translate. There are two sites: [url='https://dreamshield.codeplex.com']an english site[/url] and [url='https://dreamshield.developpez.com']a french one[/url] (the official one). Also there is [url='https://www.developpez.net/forums/f769/applications/projets/projets-heberges/dreamshield/']a forum[/url] where you can discuss. My idea was, of course, to use DreamShield for Black Mesa. Of course the installer itself isn't very important, but it was just only an idea - you can give it a try! :wink: Keep up the good work at Black Mesa and please release it soon!

It’s strange. There exist various miscellaneous software packages that I’ve found useful, and while I might suggest to someone that they might like to use a particular piece of software, there is not a single one of them that I would be able to name the lead developer of. Aside from maybe Irfanview, which I presume is made by a Mr. Irfan.

item.title: DreamShield install creator
item.dc:creator: doom_laur
item.description:
mattemuse:

Dreamshield Installer is only 5mb. It can compress images and media at rates upwards of 64.24%. The decompression algorithm not only reconstitutes your important data with 99.9% precision, it adds warmth and saturation. Dreamsheild Installer will add a Hi-Definition sheen with its advanced algorithms, to bring your media and software into the next generation of tools and software application.

Please make more posts like this because it makes me happy to hear your jokes lol

mattemuse:

doom_laur, feel free to use my true words in your ad copy on the website.

I cannot use your “true words” in DreamShield’s website because it’s not mine. If you really want contact smyley but he won’t accept because what are you saying isn’t true.

Shasta:

You have made no effort to even PRETEND to join other discussions.

That’s because I’m not the kind of person who stay long times on forums.

@all of you: I will stop posting when you guys will stop posting idiot things to make me to reply. However, this topic isn’t going nowhere with the stupid posts of some guys.

Read full topic
